text: Semyon Grigorevich Frug (born in 1860) was a writer. He was born into a family of Jewish farmers in southern Ukraine. From 1912 until his death in 1916, he lived in Odesa, where the sixth edition of his three-volume Complete Works was published in 1913. His talent was at its best in Odesa. Frug's works were mainly written in Russian with a few stories written in Yiddish. In his writing, he described the life of the Jewish colonists, their relationships with their Ukrainian and Russian neighbors, and the disagreements and occasional arguments about various Yiddish dialects. Many of Frug's poems were set to music and performed on stage. Category:Ukrainian writers Category:Ukrainian poets Category:1860 births Category:1916 deaths
